captions.text:
- [Voiceover] Here is where
all the Sun Chips are.
It's this new birth control I'm using,
- Oh, my God! Yeah, that's amazing!
Oh, wait, sorry, you have some
I can always trust you to be my mirror.
- Damn, the new guy is fine.

- This is the closest I'm
ever gonna be to a vagina.
- You were born out of one.
- But the hat plus the shirt.
- I don't wanna be right right now.
- I don't wanna be right either!
- Hey, Chris, if you were straight
would you be into me? Seriously.

- I'm sorry, sometimes
I just need to hear it

- [Chris] What's wrong?
- [Woman] I don't know if he
- [Woman] It was good, how was yours?
- Hey, can you go with me to my
Grandma's just gonna flip out if
I did hug Sam earlier today,

I thought you said you
deleted your Grindr.

- I might as well have
been scratching his armpit.

- [Chris] It wasn't me.
- [Woman] We've had this talk.

- Let me see your phone.
(phone notification)
- Ew, way to ruin the moment.

- [Woman] I think I'm
gonna break up with Jared.
- [Chris] Why? I t was one time.

If some guy scratched my
armpit when we were having sex,

I don't think I could look
at him the same way again.

- I mean, at least get a
free dinner out of him.

title: Weird Things Straight/Gay BFFs Talk About

comments.text:
This is me and my BFF (both of us are girls ^^) and we always do this kind 
of shit. Pointing out if a guy OR girl is cute and then if Jen has a guy 
that she doesn't want bothering her, I jump in and pretend to be her girl 
for a sec and save her butt. Best friendship EVER~﻿

comments.text:
I feel like they made it very obvious that this was a fun play on the 
stereotypical straight girl/gay guy best friends. I believe that a majority 
of smart people get that and as much as I have great respect for the Gay 
community & would never want to see something offensive toward them I do 
think there is a thing called being oversensitive & some of these comments 
really fit into that category. You really have to pick & choose your 
battles & if a harmless buzzfeed youtube video is something you choose to 
be offended by than I would say your just as misinformed as the people who 
stand on the side of roads with Homophobic signs and scream hateful things. 
﻿

comments.author: Victoria B

comments.text:
My best friend in all the world (since my late 20's) is a gay man...and I 
would NEVER even THINK to ask him if he wanted to make out.  Who does that?
Also, WTF on asking if he would be into you if he were straight?
How awkward.
That would just never ever happen....it would be like saying that to a 
sibling! Ew!
One of the things about our relationship that makes it what it is is that 
there is not, and never has been, and never will be sexual tension, 
expectations, or suggestions of that kind. Why would there be? Why would 
you say something like that even as a joke? That kind of thing would just 
ruin sleep overs and feeling comfortable being undressed around one another 
when you're getting ready to go somewhere or when it's a spa day and you're 
talking while you're both waxing your fun bits.  Who is going to help with 
the parts you can't do yourself once you've gone and made things weird??!?

Ugh. Watching this video made me feel uncomfortable.﻿

friends talking and stuff and then he told me that he has something to say

things like ewwww you lil faggot! I cant believe I was your friend ewwwww! 
Of course the rumor spread around and the poor guy was left friendless on 
Monday everyone bullied him and no one wanted to sit with him everyone made 
sure they sat at least 3 seats away from him I was the only person who 
talked to him, he went to the office and now we have all our classes 
together. Iam an ambassador and I made sure that nothing like that ever 
happens again. Hes an awesome person once you look beyond his orientation 
and its really Ironic how his name is Ian not giving u last name he has 
privacy 2 u know
